title: Comparatives and superlatives
description: If you complete this online course successfully you will be able to say that you are smarter than your friends and what the most difficult videogame is.

items.content:
Level: M/H 2

Dear second year mavo/havo students. Today you are going to learn more about comparing things or people. If you complete this online course successfully you will be able to say that you are smarter than your friends and what the most difficult videogame is.

The past few weeks we have practised with comparatives and superlatives. We only focussed on adjectives with 1 syllable (lettergreep) such as cheap, small and big. Today you will learn how you can make a comparative and superlative with adjectives which have 2 or more syllables such as difficult, beautiful and expensive.

The course starts with a small recap of the past 2 weeks. After this recap you will learn new information and you are going to practise with it. The course has a practise test to check yourself and ends with a test.

OM DIT ARRANGEMENT SUCCESVOL AF TE RONDEN IS HET BELANGRIJK OM ALLE STAPPEN IN HET MENU STAP VOOR TE STAP TE VOLGEN
Watch the video on this page to recap our previous classes. You are free to watch the video more than once if you don't remember everything after watching it.

Watch this video and learn how to make comparatives and superlatives with adjectives which have 2 syllables or more. You are free to watch the video more than once if you don't remember everything after watching it.

Practise with the compartive. Click on every card to see the compartive of the given adjective. Before you click, try to think of the right compartive. Then check. If you click on the adjective it will be pronounced. If you have the feeling that you understand the compartive you can scroll down and practise with the superlative. Good luck!

introduction.body:
Welcome to the practise test. This test is a good way to check if you understand comparatives and superlatives. There are 10 questions and you can get 11 points. You need 8 points to pass the test.

If you pass this test you can continue to the extra challenge. If you fail this test you will have to continue to the extra practice. Here you will be able to practise more in order to pass the final test of this course. If there is time after the extra practice you are allowed to do the extra challenge as well.

Aan het einde van de toets heb je de optie om een bewijs van deelname te krijgen. Zorg dat je deze na de toets uitprint of dat je hier een foto van neemt om aan mij te kunnen laten zien.

Good luck!

content.body: The compartive of tall is taller
Jordan is the student in our class. His grades are than mine. That is the reason that school is more for me. Life would be much more without school.

questions.label: Put the correct word on the right spot
Put the words in the correct order

prompt.body: Put the words in the correct order

content.body: The good answer should have been: He is the most important man
The comparative of sunny is sunnier
The correct superlative of difficult is the most difficult
English is the subject I have at school (amazing)
The superlative of amazing is the most amazing
The comparative of expensive is more expensive than
The superlative of fantastic is the most fantastic

items.content: Welcome to the extra practice. For some reason you did not pass the practice test and therefore you need some extra practice before you continue to the final test of this course. On this page you will recap everything you need to know about comparartives and superlatives. Good luck!

Welcome to the extra challenge.

You are here because you have passed the practice test and therefore you are ready to learn some more about comparatives and superlatives.

All compartives and superlatives we have practised with are ''regular'' adjectives. This means that they all follow a certain rule. Just like with other topics in English there are exceptions here as well. On this page you will study some of the most common and often used exceptions.

Adjective comparative superlative
good better than the best
bad worse than the worst
far further than the furthest
old (as in your older brother) elder than the eldest

Click here to practice
